alert.note: Alert for North Bighorn Basin; Southeast Bighorn Basin; Southwest Bighorn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 2:43PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Much Colder Temperatures and Snow on the Way... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Below normal temperatures, gusty north wind 15 to 25 mph, and eventual snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Much of Big Horn, Washakie, and Hot Springs Counties. * WHEN...A cold front moves through around midday Wednesday in the north and reaches Thermopolis late in the afternoon. Much colder temperatures and gusty north wind follow. Light snow arrives later Wednesday night and persists through Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Daytime highs Wednesday only reach the 30s in the north, and 45 to 50 in the southern Bighorn Basin. The snow is likely to be heaviest between 2 AM and 10 AM Thursday. Thursday highs only climb into the mid to upper 20s.

area.areaDesc: North Bighorn Basin; Southeast Bighorn Basin; Southwest Bighorn Basin
